name: Take
text:
Remove all +1/+1 counters from target creature you control. Draw that many cards.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

name: Take Down
text:
Choose one —
• Take Down deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.
• Take Down deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.

editions.flavor: The drake flew true. The arrow flew truer.

name: Take into Custody
text: Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

editions.flavor: "You can tell me what I want to know, or you can talk to the Chief of Compliance. Why don't you make it easy on yourself?"

name: Take Inventory
text: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of cards named Take Inventory in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: A place for everything, and everything in its place.

name: Takeno, Samurai General
text:
Bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
Each other Samurai creature you control gets +1/+1 for each point of bushido it has.

name: Takeno's Cavalry
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Takeno's Cavalry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking Spirit.

editions.flavor: At night he perfected his aim, shooting spiderwebs by starlight.

name: Takenuma
text:
Whenever a creature leaves the battlefield, its controller draws a card.
Whenever you roll CHAOS, return target creature you control to its owner's hand.

name: Takenuma Bleeder
text: Whenever Takenuma Bleeder attacks or blocks, you lose 1 life if you don't control a Demon.

editions.flavor: "I prefer to weave my magic through oni blood, but yours will do in a pinch."

name: Take Possession
text:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Enchant permanent
You control enchanted permanent.

name: Take Up Arms
text: Create three 1/1 white Warrior creature tokens.

editions.flavor:
"Many scales make the skin of a dragon."
—Abzan wisdom

name: Takklemaggot
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -0/-1 counter on that creature.
When enchanted creature dies, that creature's controller chooses a creature that Takklemaggot could enchant. If he or she does, return Takklemaggot to the battlefield under your control attached to that creature. If he or she doesn't, return Takklemaggot to the battlefield under your control as a non-Aura enchantment. It loses "enchant creature" and gains "At the beginning of that player's upkeep, Takklemaggot deals 1 damage to him or her."

name: Talara's Bane
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a green or white creature card from it. You gain life equal to that creature card's toughness, then that player discards that card.

editions.flavor:
"Your thoughts betray you."
—Illulia of Nighthearth

name: Talara's Battalion
text:
Trample
Cast Talara's Battalion only if you've cast another green spell this turn.

editions.flavor: The safewright Talara protects a delicate woodland waterfall. She has vowed to send wave after wave of warriors to slay any who would dare disturb its beauty.
The safewright Talara protects a delicate woodland waterfall. She has vowed to send wave after wave of warriors to slay any who would dare disturb its beauty.

name: Talas Air Ship
text: Flying

editions.flavor:
"Their ships pollute our air as they themselves pollute our forest."
—Arathel, elvish queen

name: Talas Explorer
text:
Flying
When Talas Explorer enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.

editions.flavor: The trader let loose a laugh that made all around him check their purses.

name: Talas Researcher
text: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

editions.flavor:
From time, knowledge.
From knowledge, power.

From time, knowledge.
From knowledge, power.

name: Talas Scout
text: Flying

editions.flavor:
"Scouting a battle before you fight it is just good business."
—Jefan, Talas ship captain

name: Talas Warrior
text: Talas Warrior can't be blocked.

editions.flavor: The sea is in their blood. Literally.

name: Talent of the Telepath
text:
Target opponent reveals the top seven cards of his or her library. You may cast an instant or sorcery card from among them without paying its mana cost. Then that player puts the rest into his or her graveyard.
Spell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, you may cast up to two revealed instant and/or sorcery cards instead of one.

name: Talisman of Dominance
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Talisman of Dominance deals 1 damage to you.

name: Talisman of Impulse
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Talisman of Impulse deals 1 damage to you.

name: Talisman of Indulgence
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Talisman of Indulgence deals 1 damage to you.

name: Talisman of Progress
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Talisman of Progress deals 1 damage to you.

name: Talisman of Unity
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Talisman of Unity deals 1 damage to you.

name: Tallowisp
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may search your library for an Aura card with enchant creature, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Isolated on its little candlewick, the kami never heard of the crime that drove its comrades to war.

name: Talon Gates
text:
Any time you could cast a sorcery, you may exile a nonland card from your hand with X time counters on it, where X is its converted mana cost. If the exiled card doesn't have suspend, it gains suspend. (At the beginning of its owner's upkeep, he or she removes a time counter. When the last is removed, the player casts it without paying its mana cost. If it's a creature, it has haste.)
Whenever you roll CHAOS, remove two time counters from each suspended card you own.

name: Talon of Pain
text:
Whenever a source you control other than Talon of Pain deals damage to an opponent, put a charge counter on Talon of Pain.
{X}, {T}, Remove X charge counters from Talon of Pain: Talon of Pain deals X damage to target creature or player.

name: Talonrend
text:
Flying
{U/R}: Talonrend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Change is a denizen of Shadowmoor as much as ouphes and noggles are.

name: Talon Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have first strike.

editions.flavor: "Keep them at sword's length!" Gerrard's order fell flat as each sliver's talon suddenly grew longer. "Hold on—break out the polearms!"

name: Talons of Falkenrath
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{1}{R}: This creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn."

name: Talon Trooper
text: Flying

editions.flavor: "The volcanic winds make a maze of the skies of Jund. If we mean to invade, we must first learn their invisible paths."
"The volcanic winds make a maze of the skies of Jund. If we mean to invade, we must first learn their invisible paths."

name: Talrand's Invocation
text: Create two 2/2 blue Drake creature tokens with flying.

editions.flavor: After Talrand conquered the depths of Shandalar, his ambitions drove him skyward, joined by servants whose drive and curiosity equaled his own.

name: Talrand, Sky Summoner
text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, create a 2/2 blue Drake creature token with flying.

editions.flavor: "The seas are vast, but the skies are even more so. Why be content with one kingdom when I can rule them both?"
"The seas are vast, but the skies are even more so. Why be content with one kingdom when I can rule them both?"
"The seas are vast, but the skies are even more so. Why be content with one kingdom when I can rule them both?"

name: Talruum Champion
text:
First strike
Whenever Talruum Champion blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature loses first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: In the Talruum language, there is no word for "surprised."

name: Talruum Minotaur
text: Haste

editions.flavor:
Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift.
—Suq'Ata saying

Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift.
—Suq'Ata saying

Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift.
—Suq'Ata saying

name: Talruum Piper
text: All creatures with flying able to block Talruum Piper do so.

editions.flavor: When the Talruum began to play, the dragons fell from the sky to squash the obnoxious noise.

name: Talus Paladin
text: Whenever Talus Paladin or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Allies you control gain lifelink until end of turn, and you may put a +1/+1 counter on Talus Paladin.

editions.flavor: "Why fill pockets with gold when you can fill hearts with conviction?"

name: Tamanoa
text: Whenever a noncreature source you control deals damage, you gain that much life.

editions.flavor: When Freyalise spoke the World Spell, the tamanoa rose to bring a new morning to Terisiare.

name: Tamiyo, Field Researcher
text:
+1: Choose up to two target creatures. Until your next turn, whenever either of those creatures deals combat damage, you draw a card.
−2: Tap up to two target nonland permanents. They don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
−7: Draw three cards. You get an emblem with "You may cast nonland cards from your hand without paying their mana costs."

name: Tamiyo's Journal
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
{T}, Sacrifice three Clues: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Entry 434: There's more to Avacyn's madness . . .

name: Tamiyo, the Moon Sage
text:
+1: Tap target permanent. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
−2: Draw a card for each tapped creature target player controls.
−8: You get an emblem with "You have no maximum hand size" and "Whenever a card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, you may return it to your hand."

name: Tana, the Bloodsower
text:
Trample
Whenever Tana, the Bloodsower deals combat damage to a player, create that many 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
Partner (You can have two commanders if both have partner.)

name: Tandem Lookout
text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Tandem Lookout is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "Whenever this creature deals damage to an opponent, draw a card."

name: Tandem Tactics
text: Up to two target creatures each get +1/+2 until end of turn. You gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: In times of infestation and war, Zendikar favors the blades that strike in unison.

name: Tangle
text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Each attacking creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

editions.flavor: Gaea battles rampant death with abundant life.
Gaea battles rampant death with abundant life.

name: Tangle Angler
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{G}: Target creature blocks Tangle Angler this turn if able.

editions.flavor: A plague on the curious.

name: Tangle Asp
text: Whenever Tangle Asp blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

editions.flavor:
"I have no fangs, yet I constantly bite. I have no scales, yet I slither through you. What am I?"
—Riddle of the viper's venom

name: Tanglebloom
text: {1}, {T}: You gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: The bloom contains no seeds. It's meant only to nourish the forest's inhabitants.
Druids converted swaths of the Tangle into tanglebloom orchards. Though heavy tools are needed to cut a leaf in the Tangle, tanglebloom fruit is easily plucked by hand.

name: Tangleclaw Werewolf
text:
Tangleclaw Werewolf can block an additional creature each combat.
{6}{G}: Transform Tangleclaw Werewolf.

editions.flavor:
"What has long, flesh-rending claws and enormous, bone-crushing teeth?"
—Halana, Kessig ranger

name: Tangle Golem
text: Affinity for Forests (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Forest you control.)

editions.flavor: The longer it weaves through the twisted vines of the Tangle, the more it adopts their hidden strength.

name: Tangle Hulk
text: {2}{G}: Regenerate Tangle Hulk.

editions.flavor:
"A true Phyrexian predator. It will never know death, just as nature intended."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Tangle Kelp
text:
Enchant creature
When Tangle Kelp enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step if it attacked during its controller's last turn.

name: Tangle Mantis
text: Trample

editions.flavor: The fiercest hunters in the Tangle don't seek out the mantises. They are the mantises.

name: Tangleroot
text: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, that player adds {G} to his or her mana pool.

editions.flavor: As if there's glitch in the system, the Tangle sometimes folds in on itself, throwing off sparks of mana in a mystifying display.

name: Tanglesap
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures without trample.

editions.flavor:
"The blood of the forest is beholden to no one."
—Nissa Revane

name: Tangle Spider
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: They're considered good luck by the elves they don't eat.
Only rumors have ever escaped its web.

name: Tanglewalker
text: Each creature you control can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an artifact land.

editions.flavor: In bringing life to Mirrodin, Memnarch was more successful than he knew—for Mirrodin began to take on a life of its own.

name: Tangle Wire
text:
Fading 4 (This artifact enters the battlefield with four fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player taps an untapped artifact, creature, or land he or she controls for each fade counter on Tangle Wire.

name: Taniwha
text:
Trample
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, all lands you control phase out. (They phase in before you untap during your next untap step.)

editions.flavor:
"Taniwha rolls in its sleep, and the land is awash with the waves."
—Poetics of Hanan

name: Taoist Hermit
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: Taoists chose to be hermits for many reasons, but all shared one unchanging goal: to follow the Tao.

name: Taoist Mystic
text: Taoist Mystic can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.

editions.flavor: By appearing in places miles apart at the same time, Zuo Ci exhibited the mystic's ability to "shrink the land."

name: Tapestry of the Ages
text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you've cast a noncreature spell this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Abzan, Jeskai, Sultai, Mardu, Temur—names lost to history, yet worthy of further study."
—Narset

name: Tar Fiend
text:
Devour 2 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with twice that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Tar Fiend enters the battlefield, target player discards a card for each creature it devoured.

name: Tarfire
text: Tarfire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
editions.flavor:

Flying, vigilance

editions.flavor:

name: Tariff
text: Each player sacrifices the creature he or she controls with the highest converted mana cost unless he or she pays that creature's mana cost. If two or more creatures a player controls are tied for highest cost, that player chooses one.

name: Tarmogoyf
text: Tarmogoyf's power is equal to the number of card types among cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.

editions.flavor: What doesn't grow, dies. And what dies grows the tarmogoyf.

name: Tarnished Citadel
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Tarnished Citadel deals 3 damage to you.

name: Tarox Bladewing
text:
Flying, haste
Grandeur — Discard another card named Tarox Bladewing: Tarox Bladewing gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is its power.

editions.flavor: Despising his siblings as insults to his line, he finds and devours each in turn.

name: Tarpan
text: When Tarpan dies, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"A good Tarpan will serve you, faithful and true. A bad one will kick you in the head."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

"A good tarpan will serve you, faithful and true. A bad one will kick you in the head."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Tar Pitcher
text: {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Tar Pitcher deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
editions.flavor:
"Auntie Grub had caught a goat, a bleating doe that still squirmed in her arms. At the same time, her warren decided to share with her a sensory greeting of hot tar . . . ."

name: Tar Pit Warrior
text: When Tar Pit Warrior becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.

editions.flavor:
"The cyclops shrugged off savage blows, but casual insults made him weep."
—Azeworai, "The Cyclops who Couldn't"

"The cyclops shrugged off savage blows, but casual insults made him weep."
—Azeworai, "The Cyclops who Couldn't"

name: Tar Snare
text: Target creature gets -3/-2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The amorphous, magically animated residue known as the Fathom Sludge lurks in the Hagra Cistern, attacking its prey with pseudopods and dragging it down to be digested.

name: Tasigur's Cruelty
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Each opponent discards two cards.

editions.flavor: The cruelest tortures leave no mark upon the flesh.

name: Tasigur, the Golden Fang
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
{2}{G/U}{G/U}: Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard, then return a nonland card of an opponent's choice from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Task Force
text: Whenever Task Force becomes the target of a spell or ability, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: They are the reflection of Rushwood's glow on the edge of a wooden sword.

name: Task Mage Assembly
text:
When there are no creatures on the battlefield, sacrifice Task Mage Assembly.
{2}: Task Mage Assembly deals 1 damage to target creature. Any player may activate this ability but only any time he or she could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: There is no dress code for the Inventors' Fair, but you'll be hard-pressed to find anyone or anything not done up in their finest.

name: Taste for Mayhem
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0.
Hellbent — Enchanted creature gets an additional +2/+0 as long as you have no cards in hand.

editions.flavor: The taste of blood breaks down what little self-control the Rakdos possess.

name: Taste of Blood
text: Taste of Blood deals 1 damage to target player and you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"How blessed are some people, whose lives have no fears, no dreads, to whom sleep is a blessing that comes nightly, and brings nothing but sweet dreams."
—Bram Stoker, Dracula

name: Taste of Paradise
text:
As an additional cost to cast Taste of Paradise, you may pay {1}{G} any number of times.
You gain 3 life plus an additional 3 life for each additional {1}{G} you paid.

editions.flavor:
"There is, in each of us, the potential to heal and the gift of renewed life."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"Any who drink of Freyalise's bounty drink the mead of rebirth."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Tatsumasa, the Dragon's Fang
Tattered Drake
text:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Tattered Drake.

editions.flavor:
"Drakes embody the worst of Ravnica: great potential, twisted by selfishness and greed."
—Razia

name: Tattered Haunter
text:
Flying
Tattered Haunter can block only creatures with flying.

editions.flavor: When the Nebelgast recedes, there are often stragglers.

name: Tattered Mummy
text: When Tattered Mummy dies, each opponent loses 2 life.

editions.flavor: The dead who wander beyond the safety of the city crave only to spread their curse.

name: Tatterkite
text:
Flying
Tatterkite can't have counters placed on it.

editions.flavor:
"I rigged it together from wicker and scrap, yet somehow I find it unalterably perfect."
—Braenna, cobblesmith

name: Tattermunge Duo
text:
Whenever you cast a red spell, Tattermunge Duo gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a green spell, Tattermunge Duo gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

name: Tattermunge Maniac
text: Tattermunge Maniac attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: It shows up at one meal wearing the carcass of the last.

name: Tattermunge Witch
text: {R}{G}: Each blocked creature gets +1/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Tattermunge gang has no words for the spell that whips their instinctual rage into a frenzy. They only know they like it.
The Tattermunge gang has no words for the spell that whips their instinctual rage into a frenzy. They only know they like it.

name: Tattoo Ward
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has protection from enchantments. This effect doesn't remove Tattoo Ward.
Sacrifice Tattoo Ward: Destroy target enchantment.

name: Taunt
text: During target player's next turn, creatures that player controls attack you if able.

name: Taunting Challenge
text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.

editions.flavor: Incensed by their opponents' unrelenting taunts, even wise generals were known to rashly lead their troops into battle—often to disastrous defeats.

name: Taunting Elf
text: All creatures able to block Taunting Elf do so.

editions.flavor: Much to Multani's chagrin, Rofellos gleefully tutored Yavimaya's elves on the rudest and most vulgar words spoken in Llanowar.
The safety of the village depends on the beast thinking with its stomach.

name: Taurean Mauler
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Taurean Mauler.

editions.flavor: The power of a waterfall. The fury of an avalanche. The intellect of a gale-force wind.

name: Tavern Swindler
text: {T}, Pay 3 life: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, you gain 6 life.

editions.flavor: Rakdos cultists are her best customers. They never flinch at pain and are seldom good at math.
Rakdos cultists are her best customers. They never flinch at pain and are seldom good at math.

name: Tawnos
text: You may cast artifact, creature, and enchantment spells as though they had flash.

editions.flavor: Tawnos brings a childlike wonder and an inherent skill to Urza's studio and bridges the wizardry of the workshop with the grandeur of the royal court. His speed and flexibility quickly earned him promotion from apprentice to master artificer.

name: Tawnos's Coffin
text:
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Coffin during your untap step.
{3}, {T}: Exile target creature and all Auras attached to it. Note the number and kind of counters that were on that creature. When Tawnos's Coffin leaves the battlefield or becomes untapped, return that exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control tapped with the noted number and kind of counters on it. If you do, return the other exiled cards to the battlefield under their owner's control attached to that permanent.

name: Tawnos's Wand
text: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

name: Tawnos's Weaponry
text:
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.

editions.flavor: When war machines became too costly, Tawnos's weaponry replaced them.
When Urza's war machines became too costly, Tawnos's weaponry replaced them.
